item.title: Is it time to rewrite the web?
item.description: The problem One of the most recited rules of software developement is that a rewrite is nearly never a good idea. But what if your project is 30 years old and was originally intended as a system to share static documents, now being used for games, photo editing software, and even virtual machines? The mantra of avoiding rewrites fundamentally applies because of the old adage “If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it”, but I would argue that the modern web is extremely broke.
